item.title: Create a VMware ESXi 5 PXE unattended scripted installation using Windows
item.description: The most information available on how-to perform a unattended scripted installation of VMware ESXi 5 is based on Linux. Here is a procedure how-to create a scripted installation of VMware ESXi 5 using Microsoft Windows. Here is an overview of the boot process: What do we need The following software must be downloaded: Syslinux 3.86 (This is the Syslinux version VMware supports) FileZilla Server 0_9_39 TFTPD 4.00 Notepad ++ VMware ESXi 5 ISO Step 1 Windows XP This procedure is tested with Microsoft Windows XP SP2.

item.title: Things to consider when upgrading to vSphere 4.1
item.description: The new vSphere 4.1 release offers a lot of new cool features and enhancements. Here’s a list What’s New in vSphere 4.1. When upgrading to vSphere 4.1 there are a couple of things to think about before starting: Make sure your systems and components are supported, check the Hardware Compatibility Guide . Verify that other products are compatible with vSphere 4.1. For example VMware View 4 is not supported on vSphere 4.
